alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 10:35PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Boyd, southeastern Lawrence, Cabell and northern Wayne Counties through 1100 PM EST... At 1034 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ceredo, or near Chesapeake, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Wayne, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Beech Fork State Park, Cannonsburg, Barboursville, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Ona, Durbin, Centerville, Burnaugh, South Point, Burlington, Athalia, Lockwood and Lavalette. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 185 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
